short: If all your friends wear jeans to school and you wear checkered slacks, you could say you reject conformity ŌĆö doing the same thing as everyone else.
long: Conformity usually refers to people's behavior or looks, but it can also be used to describe something that matches the form of something else ŌĆö for example, a one-story house built in conformity to the low-slung buildings that surround it.  It's common for conformity to follow the word in.
